Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de condimentos, venta de fajas, venta de frazada, venta de polleras, confección de mantas, venta de polleras y awayos, venta de guantes, venta de tucumanas, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Sabina es parte integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos, cuenta que esta con este negocio desde hace 26 años, ya que lo aprendió de su madre y posteriormente ella lo trabajó.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Mañaneras” (Early-Rising Women) communal bank will start its 25th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board with Sabina as Treasurer.  The members of the association carry out a variety of business activities like neighborhood store, clothing sales, condiment sales, sash sales, blanket sales, skirt sales, blanket weaving, skirt and traditional textile sales, glove sales, turnover sales and cosmetics sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen in a variety of lines of work.  Sabina is one of them.  She says she’s been part of Pro Mujer for five years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who’s a member of the institution.  She currently sells condiments and says she’s been in business 26 years; she learned it from her mother and subsequently she took it over.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy condiments from wholesale stores and then resell them in her shop.  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her home however possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services, the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: José Albeiro

texts.es: José Albeiro de 63 años de edad, es un hombre al que desde niño le tocó trabajar, debido a la situación económica de su familia. A los 12 años inició como ayudante en la carnicería de su padre, allí aprendió el oficio. Posteriormente decidió montar su propio negocio dedicándose de tiempo completo a esta actividad laborando diariamente de 8 a 7 de la noche. José tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, a los que espera poderles ofrecer un mejor futuro, brindándoles la oportunidad de ingresar a la escuela con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor sueño es ampliar el negocio y su capacidad instalada, por lo cual solicita un préstamo con el que pretende realizar reformas en el cuarto frío y mejoras locativas.
texts.en:
José Alberto, 63, is a man who has had to work since he was a little boy because of his family’s economic situation.  At the age of 12 he started out as a helper in his father’s butcher shop and he learned the occupation there.  Later on, he decided to open his own business going into it full-time working from 8am until 7pm.  

José has two children who are 10 and 8 years old who he hopes to provide with a better future giving them the opportunity of attending school in order to improve their quality of life.  His greatest dream is to expand the business and his installed capacity which is why he’s asking for a loan he intends to use to make changes to the cold storage room and physical improvements to the shop.

loans.use: to improve the cold storage room and do physical improvements to the shop.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José es un cliente de credituyo desde hace varios años, el acudió a nuestra ayuda ya que quiere terminar de construir, su hogar ya que la parte trasera esta sin terminar, en esta temporada de lluvia se inunda la parte trasera, y genera mucha humedad el quiere terminar de construir, ya que su hija esta enferma de asma y la humedad le hace mucho daño.
El sueño de Juan José es tener un hogar mas grande y bien construido para la llegada de otro bebe.
texts.en: Juan José has been a Credituyo client for several years. He came to us for help to finish building his home, since the back part of the the house is unfinished. The back part is flooded in this rainy season, and this causes a lot of humidity. He wants to finish building, since his daughter has asthma and the humidity is ver harmful to her. Juan José's dream is to have a bigger and better-built house for the arrival of the other baby.

loans.use: to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es: La socia tiene 35 años de edad y pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, fideos, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This borrower is 35 years old and belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” of the “Asociación Arariwa.”  Her principal economic activity is food sales.  On this occasion she requires the loan to buy supplies like, for example, meat, vegetables, noodles, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.  She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream by means of this method and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established period of time.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, noodles, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El socio tiene 30 años de edad y pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la administración de su propio bar donde expende diferentes bebidas alcohólicas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del bar es decir va arreglar las sillas y mesas. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This borrower, Ruben, is 30 years old and belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”, part of the MFI Asociación Arariwa. His main business is running his own bar where he offers many different types of alcoholic drinks. At this time he is asking for a loan in order to maintain the bar and make improvements to some of the tables and chairs. He is very grateful to those who will help this dream come true, and he promises to comply with all loan repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to make improvements to the bar (to fix chairs and tables)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials including ceramic and zinc

loans.name: Leydi Noemy

texts.es:
Leydi tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella estudio hasta el bachillerato opción contaduría, ha sido una persona muy aplicada en sus estudios, su familia se ha esforzado mucho para que ella estudiara, sus estudios básicos los realizo en la escuela de su comunidad y el bachillerato lo estudio en un instituto que esta a cinco kilómetros de su casa viajo durante tres años hasta terminar su estudio. Luego se caso y procreo una hija que tiene dos años, llamada Marisela.  Ella se siente muy feliz con su hija y su esposo, que trabaja en las fincas de café se levanta a las 3:00 a.m. para estar en la finca a las 6:00 a.m. y sale de su trabajo a las 2:00 p.m. también cultiva maíz, frijoles. Por su parte, Leydi se encarga de administrar su propia tienda desde hace tres años, que esta instalada en casa de sus padres. 

Para comprar la mercadería tiene que viajar un kilómetro ya sea a pie o en pick up hasta el lugar donde espera el autobús; aborda el autobús durante 15 kilómetros para llegara la ciudad. A veces su papá le realiza el viaje en su pick up. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar golosinas, bebidas, maíz, fríjol, aceite, café, papel higiénico, etc. y el resto para cancelar una deuda con la Fundación. Así, dispondrá de suficiente mercadería para ofrecer a su clientes y que estos no se marchen con las vacías de su tienda y que siempre la prefieran; para que su negocio vaya creciendo y obteniendo ganancias para su familia. Su deseo es instalar una venta de pupusas, vender calzado en la tienda.
texts.en:
Leydi is 26 years old. She is married and has a child. She graduated from secondary school in the accounting option. She has been very devoted to her studies, and her family made a great effort so that she could go to school. She did her basic schooling in the school in the community and her secondary studies at an institute that is five kilometers from her house. She traveled there for three years until she completed her studies. Then she married and had a daughter, Marisela, who is now two years old. She is very happy with her daughter and her husband, who works on the coffee plantations. He gets up every day at 3 a.m. to be at the plantation at 6 a.m., and he leaves work at 2 p.m. He also grows corn and beans. On her part, Leydi has been in charge of running her own store for three years. It is located in her parents' house. 

To buy merchandise she has to travel a kilometer by foot or in a pickup to the place where she waits for the bus. She travels on the bus for 15 kilometers to reach the city. Sometimes her father makes the trip in his pickup.

She is applying for the loan to buy candies, beverages, corn, beans, coffee, toilet paper, etc., and the rest is to pay off a debt to the Foundation. This will provide sufficient merchandise to offer to her customers, so that they will not leave because of the emptiness of her store and they will always prefer to go to her, so that her business will continue growing and obtaining earnings for her family. Her wishes are to set up a store to sell pupusas (a typical Ecuadorean food) and to sell shoes in the store.

loans.use: to buy candies, beverages, corn, beans, oil, coffee, toilet paper, etc., and use the rest to pay off a debt to the Foundation

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Lucia es integrante del grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras, es una mujer madura de 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años, ambos estudian; Lucia se dedica a la venta por catalogo de artículos varios, joyería y ropa semi nueva. Hace 3 años inició vendiendo joyería, después ropa usada en mercados rodantes y ahora vende también vasijas de plástico y utensilios de cocina. El crédito lo utilizara para surtir vasijas y comprar pacas de ropa. Lucia quiere algún día llegar a tener una taquería. Mujeres Emprendedoras es un grupo bueno, antiguo y todas sus integrantes se llevan muy bien.
texts.en: Lucia s a member of the group "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women). She is 31 years old, married, and has two children, 11 and 6 years old, both of whom are in school. Lucia works selling various catalogue items, including jewelry and semi-new clothing. She started selling the jewelry three years ago, and afterwards began with used clothing in nearby markets. Now, she also sells plastic bins and kitchen utensils. The loan that she is asking for will be used to stock her business with more plastic bins, and also to buy bundles of clothes in order to sell. Lucia would like to own a taco shop one day. Mujeres Emprendedores is a good group, has been with the institution for a long time, and all of its members get along very well.

loans.use: to stock her business with plastic bins and bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Benigno Julio

texts.es: El socio continúa en el banco comunal “Qorichaska del Cusco” y con la reparación de equipos de cómputo y periféricos. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como CD, memorias y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: This borrower is part of the communal bank “Qorichaska del Cusco”, and works repairing computers and other electronic items. He is a very friendly and responsible person who works hard to support his family and get ahead. At this time he is asking for a loan in order to buy materials such as CDs, memory cards, and other computer items. He is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with all loan repayments when due.

loans.use: to buy materials such as CDs, memory cards, and other computer items

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El socio tiene 30 años de edad y pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de plásticos, bolsas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como plásticos. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old and belongs to the communal bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Lucre”, part of the microfinance institution Asociación Arariwa. His main business is the sale of plastic materials, including bags and other things. On this occasion he is asking for a loan in order to buy more plastic merchandise. He is very grateful for those who are helping him reach his dream, and he promises to repay all loan installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as plastic bags and other plastic materials

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy was born in 1974. She has two children. One of them is learning at secondary school. Another dropped out of school. He is helping his mother, making noodles at home. Quy’s husband is a building worker. His salary is about 4,000,000 dong (VND). Quy makes noodles and raises pigs to earn a living. She gets 4,000,000 dong (VND). Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last loan cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND, to buy more ingredients to make noodles. She always wants to use her profits to raise her children well and enlarge her noodle workshop.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make noodles.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Ms. Kaneez is a 40-year-old married woman. She is in the business of purchasing and selling goats with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kaneez’s husband. They buy small goats, bring them up and resell them for a higher price near the occasion of eid-ul-azha (a sacred event for Muslims). They are happily doing it together to meet the needs of their seven children. Kaneez has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. To help her to continue her operations, she requested a loan of 18,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR), which she will use with her past savings to purchase two more goats. It is her third loan cycle and she has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To purchase two more goats to sell.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián es comerciante de ropa desde hace varios años, es casado tiene dos hijos que están estudiando primaria y secundaria, el vende ropa en los tianguis, acudió a credituyo, para que se le otorgara un crédito y surtir ropa de temporada, ya que tiene muy poca mercancia.
El quiere aprovechar la oferta de un lote de ropa de invierno, para así tener buen inventario de mercancía, de temporada e incrementar sus ventas, el sueño de Julián es llegar a tener una bodega grande de ropa de mayoreo, y que lo puedan  atender sus hijos. 
Para que ellos tengan su propio negocio, y no tengan que salir a trabajar a otra parte,y asi poder convivir todo el tiempo con ellos. 
Julián esta muy contento por haberle otorgado el crédito.
texts.en: Julián has been selling clothing for several years.  He is married and has two children who are studying in primary and middle school.  He sells clothing in the small roadside shops.  He came to Kiva field partner Credituyo to ask for a loan in order to supply his clothing business for the season, since he currently has very little merchandise.  He wants to take advantage of the offer of a batch of winter clothing in order to have a better inventory for the season and to increase his sales.  Julian's dream is to have his own large wholesale clothing store, and for his children to be able to work with him.  That would allow them to have their own business and not have to work in another place.  In that way he would be able to continue living with them.  Julian is very happy to have been granted the loan.

loans.use: To invest in seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is 23-year-old married woman; she has three sons living with her. Her husband is a factory employee and able to earn 5000 Rs in a month. Due to the growing prices of basic necessities of life it was very hard for them to survive on the limited income of her husband. One day she told her husband that she wanted to do some work to support his income. Komal’s husband appreciated her idea. One day Komal’s husband bought a digital camera for her with bonus money he received from the factory. Komal started offering photographic services in her neighborhood for events such as weddings, birthdays, etc. With the help of her husband, she built relationships in the market to make prints of all the photos taken at discounted rates. 

She is now able to earn a reasonable amount of money from this business. She expressed that the camera she has now is not of good quality, and she has to miss out on clients because camera is not capable of low-light photography. Komal wants to increase the scale of her services and needs another camera of better quality and a reflection umbrella to cater to these customers. For that purpose she is requesting 25000 Rs from Kashf Foundation.  It would help her to make her customers more satisfied.

loans.use: to buy another camera of better quality and a reflection umbrella to cater to her customers.

loans.name: Abundancia Group

texts.es: Abundancia es un grupo solidario conformado por 5 integrantes, mujeres que luchan para poder progresar. Perla es una joven de 29 años, tiene 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer separada, por lo cual es el sostén de su familia y recibe con una pensión alimenticia por parte de su ex pareja; Perla se dedica a la venta de maquillaje y productos por catalogo. A ella le ayudaría mucho el crédito porque tiene que surtir mas productos y maquillaje para vender. Una meta importante para Perla es sacar adelante a sus hijos y superarse.
texts.en: Abundancia is a solidarity group made up of 5 members. They are women who fight to be able to move forward. Perla, 29, has three children, ages 13, 10, and 6. She is separated, which means that she supports her family and gets child support from her ex partner. Perla works selling makeup and products from a catalogue. The loan would help her a lot because she needs to stock up on products and makeup to sell. An important goal for Perla is to move her children forward and better herself.

loans.use: to buy products and makeup.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is a responsible housewife who buys and sells vegetables in her village. This is her way of helping her husband generate income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their five children. She aims to improve her business to satisfy her customers' demand and earn a higher income, but she suffers from an insufficiency of capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy cabbage, eggplant, okra, beans, and gabi for sale. She believes that through her hard work, she can make her business a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, eggplant, okra, beans, and gabi

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en:
Mrs. Zohran is a 32-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past four years. She has extraordinary skills in her line of work. She takes many orders for special events, like weddings and engagements. Her husband is laborer, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. She is contributing to the family's income to meet the needs of the family members. She is a mother of six children. 

Zohran wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy embroidery materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in various colors. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so the girls could help her expand her business, and earn money for themselves at the same time. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market, to display her work.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in various colors.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Regardless of her difficulties, Trinidad aims to become financially stable in the future. She is 52 years old and who engages in selling AVON, MSE, and NATASHA products. She also runs a general store in the community and has been operating the business for almost three years. With these businesses, she usually earns a profit of PHP8, 000 a month, which she utilizes for their basic necessities, such as food. She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP15, 000 to order the requested products for her customers from AVON, MSE, and NATASHA.  She will also use the loan to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and soaps for resale. Through hard work, she believes that she will be able to improve her businesses and make them more advantageous and profitable.

loans.use: to order the requested products for her customers in AVON, MSE, NATASHA and to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1965. She has six children; three of them have got married. The youngest three are four years old, two years old and four months old. Her husband sells fresh fruits in a market. Lan raises pigs and sells vegetables to earn a living. She gets 4,000,000 VND a month from it. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy food for her pigs. Her dream is to let her children achieve good jobs and enlarge her vegetable store.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories.

loans.name: María Yaneth

texts.es: María Yaneth tiene 27 años de edad  y desde niña le ha gustado la panificación, Todos los días se levanta muy temprano, se dirige  a la cocina y comienza su faena con la preparación de pasteles y panes que le encargan sus vecinos y personas del sector. Con esta actividad ella sostiene sus estudios universitarios. Su mayor deseo es montar su propio negocio con servicio de cafetería y repostería, proyecto en el cual se encuentra trabajando. En la actualidad busca solicita un crédito para la compra de latas, insumos y materiales para la elaboración de sus productos ya que en diciembre se aumentan sus pedidos y es una excelente oportunidad para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Yaneth is 27 years old and she has liked to bake ever since she was a child. She wakes up early every morning, and goes to the kitchen to prepare pies and bread that her neighbors and local people order. This line of work makes it possible for María Yaneth to pay for her university studies.

Her biggest dream is to open her own establishment, a sort of cafeteria/bakery, and she is currently working on this project. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and materials needed for making her products. December is a time of the year when she receives a lot of orders, which makes it an excellent opportunity for her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for baking.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel originario de la Comarca el Cerro  de Piedra, Teustepe, Municipio de Boaco, casado, padre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, como es la siembra de maíz y frijoles, además de este negocio tiene otro como es  la pulpería, del que es propietario hace 20 años, el inicio sus actividades agrícolas  con dinero que le presto un amigo, el  vende sus producto en  Managua, sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio.

Miguel en esta ocasión esta solicitando el préstamo para  comprar pantalones y camisas para agregar mas productos de mercadería en su inventario. El estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a reforzar su negocio, ya que se acerca la época navideña en donde la demanda de sus productos crece y sus ventas aumentarían. Sus planes futuros es ahorrar dinero para hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the district Cerro de Piedra, Teustepe, in the municipality of Boasco. He is married and the father of five children who are now of independent age. He currently makes a living in agriculture, planting corn and beans. He also has a small convenience store, which he has owned for 20 years. He began his agricultural activities with money he lent from a friend. He sells his products in Managua and hopes to grow his business. 

Migual es requesting this loan to buy pants and shirts to add more products to his inventory. He estimates that this loan will help him to strengthen his business since the Christmas season is coming in which the demand for his products grows and his sales will increase. He plans to save money to make improvements to his home in the future.

loans.use: to buy pants and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: María Florentina

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y laboriosa; cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en todas las actividades pecuarias que realiza; ya que ella cuida ganado y cerdos, los mantiene en el patio de su casa. A ella siempre le ha gustado poseer animales, los cuales vende cuando se lo buscan las personas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos bueyes. Estos los alimentara y amansará para venderlos posteriormente a un mejor precio. Su puposito, es contar con suficientes ingresos para brindar a su familia una mejor vida y continuar trabajando con la Fundación.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, married and has three children. She is a very happy and hard working person who relies on the help of her family in the work that she does raising livestock. She raises livestock and pigs, caring for them in the back of her house. She has always liked having animals and sells them when customers look to buy them. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two oxen. She will feed and tame them to sell them at a better price. Her goal is to have enough income to give her family a better quality life and continue working with the Foundation.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Nohemy Elizabeth

texts.es: Nohemy Elizabeth de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo entre otros, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene los mejores precios con producto de calidad, y el servicio mas rápido; Nohemy es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de los miembros, la casa necesita reparaciones y modificaciones necesita poner piso cerámico y hacer divisiones en los cuartos,  quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad en su hogar, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia pues sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, cerámico, ladrillos, herramienta etc. Nohemy Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nohemy Elizabeth is 25 years old and lives with her life partner and son.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products such as basic grains, bread, snacks, instant products, and other things.  She has several years’ experience in this business and it has given her the opportunity to improve her income.  The store is located in a good location and she has many customers because people prefer to buy from her because she has the best prices, quality products, and fastest service.

Nohemy is very dedicated to her work and prepared to give her all to achieve her dreams.  The most important thing in her life is her family.  The deterioration of her house in the past weeks has upset the tranquility and the family members.  The house needs repairs and upgrades such as a tile floor and walls between rooms.  She wants to get this done as soon as possible for the security of her home.  Her greatest secret is her perseverance because she knows that this is how she will be successful.  She needs to make this investment bus doesn’t have the necessary capital, so she has approached INTEGRAL to request a loan.  She will use the money to buy cement, bricks, tools, etc.

Nohemy Elizabeth has a good record of payment and is certain that she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 42-year-old married lady who has faced difficult times in the recent past; due to insufficient household income she was not able to feed her children. Her husband as the sole earner of the house seemed not to be able to deal with the situation. For the betterment of her family Hameeda decided to start some economic activity. She contacted the Kashf foundation, managed to receive a loan for her husband’s shop and invested those funds in the business in her first two loan cycles. Hameeda is competent enough to help her husband in his iron scrap business. Now they work in different time shifts to cater to the maximum number of customers. Hameeda wants to grow her family business further by getting a new scale and some tools required to press iron material. For that purpose she needs a loan of 45,000 Rs. It would make her business operations smooth and efficient.

loans.use: to buy a new scale and some tools required to press iron material.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Don Francisco es químico Farmacéutico y la mayor parte de su vida ejerció su carrera, pero por circunstancias de la vida se quedó sin empleo y se vio en la obligación de buscar una alternativa de ingresos para su sustento. Por esta razón tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar su propio negocio, enfocándose en el sector de piñatería, especialmente en la venta de tortas. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su línea de productos por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un congelador pequeño para helados y la compra de dulcería para la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Francisco is a pharmaceutical chemist, and he has practiced his career for the greatest part of his life.  However, life’s circumstances left him without work, and he was obliged to look for an alternative income for his support.  That is why he made the decision to become independent and set up his own business.  His business focuses on party items and, especially on selling cakes.

His greatest dream is to expand his line of products.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy a small freezer for ice cream and to buy candy for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Hugo Arley

texts.es: Hugo de 32 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 6 y 11 años, los cuales son su prioridad en la vida. Desde hace Varios años es panadero, actividad que le genera el sustento para su familia. Hace un mes tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar su propia empresa con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y generar mayores ingresos para ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de surtido,  una vitrina, cafetera, freidora. Herramientas que le hacen falta para la productividad de su negocio. Su mayor sueño es poder acreditar su empresa con el fin de obtener un mayor número de clientes y generar mayores rendimientos, que destinará para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo, 32, is the father of two children of 6 and 11, who are his number one priority.  He has been a baker for a number of years and his earnings have been sufficient to cover his family's expenses.     

A month ago he decided to go it alone and set up his own business. His intention is to improve his quality of life and increase his income so as to be able to provide a good education for his children.  

He is now seeking a loan for the purchase of stock and a display case, a coffee maker and a deep fryer, which he needs to ensure his business's productivity.

His greatest dream is to be able to build the reputation of his business so as to attract more customers and, in turn, generate increased income which he will use for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock and fixed assets

loans.name: Thomas

texts.es:
Don Thomas con 57 años de edad, casado, padre de 7 hijos, de oficio comerciante,  es habitante de la comarca el Nancintal -Teustepe, es propietario de una pulpería el distribuye arroz, azúcar, jabón. El   comenta que le ha ido bien en su negocio, además vende leche y cuajadas de las vacas que tiene. Tomas dice que las tierras  que posee hoy en día son propia, en donde cultiva sus granos básicos como arroz, frijoles y trigos. Sus expectativas es ampliar  su negocio para aumentar su producción de siembra.

En esta ocasión Thomas  necesita el  crédito Para comprar dos terneros para repastarlos y engordarlos. Lo  cual le será de ayuda, ya que al comprar mas ganado, aumentaría su producción de animales y asi podrá obtener mejores ganancias. Sus  planes futuros es surtir su pulpería de productos que aun no tiene en existencia y de esta manera obtener mejores ingreso para seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería.
texts.en: Thomas, 57, is married and has 7 children. He is a trader who lives in the Nancintal - Teustepe region. He owns a small grocery store where he sells rice, sugar, and soap. He says that things have been going well for him in his business. He also sells milk and curds from the cows that he has. Tomas says that the land that he has today is his own, where he grows basic grains like rice, beans, and wheat. His expectation is to be able to expand his business to increase his plantings. On this occasion, Thomas needs the loan to buy two two calves to graze and fatten. This would help him, since if he bought more livestock, it would increase his production of animals and he will be able to earn a better income. His plan for the future is to stock his grocery store with products that he doesn't have and that way get a better income to keep investing in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy two calves to graze and fatten

loans.name: Halcones De Cascada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HALCONES DE CASCADA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, hilado de lana de alpaca, venta de carne, macramé de mantas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Amalia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de camisas, que aprendió hace años por la necesidad de realizar un negocio de apoyo económico.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su capital (compra de camisas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. group "Halcones de Cascada" is starting it's third cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal Cascada. It is comprised of nine members and is directed by a board where Armalia is the President. The business the members of this community association carry out are diverse: selling clothing, alpaca yarn, meat, macramé blankets and food. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs with distinct areas. Amalia is an integral part and says that she entered Pro Mujer four years ago, at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling shirts, which she learned years ago out of need for economic support. 

The loan she will take out now, it is diversify her capital (purchase shirts) that she will acquire from wholesale stores and later sell in her trading post. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is married and has five children. 

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health training and loans.

loans.use: purchase shirts.

loans.name: Amanecer Andino Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER ANDINO”  iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marleny es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tejedora de mantas, venta de cerveza, venta de alimentos, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de frescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Marleny es parte integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, cuenta que la habilidad para la elaboración de estas prendas la aprendió observado a sus amigas y posteriormente está técnica le ayudo a realizar un negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilo) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito, salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Amanecer Andino” will initiate the twentieth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Juan Pablo II. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors where Marleny is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are diverse. Among these are: the sale of clothing, blanket weaving, beer sales, the sale of groceries, the sale of candy, food sales, and the sale of fresh foods.

The loan that they will borrow will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs with different areas, where Marleny is a part member. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining through the invitation of her sister who is a member of the institution. Now, she has a blanket-sewing business. She says that she learned the production of these items by observing her friends and subsequently this technique helped her to start a business.

The loan that she will now borrow is to increase her capital (the purchase of thread) that she will acquire in distribution stores and subsequently the she will produce the blankets upon request. This form of work will permit her to generate resources to support her home when possible since she is single and has two children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of loans, health, and training.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Doña Marleny de 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, los cuales le ha tocado educar sola debido a que su esposo nunca se hizo responsable. La vida para ella no ha sido fácil, hace 5 meses se quedó sin vivienda por un  incendio ocurrido en el sector, en donde resultó damnificada tras haberse destruido su vivienda por completo. Debido a esto ella decidió dedicarse a  la preparación de alimentos, iniciando su negocio con la venta de fritos, refrigerios, desayunos y almuerzos. Todos los días labora de 4:30 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su mayor sueño es montar un restaurante de comida de mar. En el momento se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de insumos y materias primas para la elaboración de sus productos, ya que no cuenta con el  dinero para realizarle  esta inversión a su negocio.
texts.en: Marleny is a 57 year old single mother of 5 children. She has had to bring them up alone because her husband has never been responsible. Life has not been easy for her. Five months ago they were without a home because of a fire that happened in their area that completely destroyed their home. Because of this, she decided to work selling food. She started her business with selling fried foods, snacks, breakfasts and lunches. Every day she works from 4:30 in the morning until 7 at night. Her biggest dream is to open a seafood restaurant. Now she is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients and raw materials for making her products, since she does not have the capital to make this investment in her business.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and raw materials

loans.name: Urbanisacion Leon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URBANIZACIÓN LEÓN”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de chocolate, tejido de mantas, venta de aceite, venta de zapatos, compra y venta de repuestos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Andrea es parte integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de repuestos, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió con su esposo y en la actualidad lo trabajan ambos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el prestamos que se hace en grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Urbanizacion Leon will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is comprised of seven members and is led by a board of directors, of which Andrea is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members run are varied and include: clothing sales, chocolate sales, fabric blankets, (cooking) oil sales, shoe sales, and the buying and selling of spare parts.

This loan will benefit the small businesses in their distinct areas. Andrea is a member; she says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining because of an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Now she (Andrea) has a business buying and selling spare parts. She says that she started this business with her husband, and they are working together.

The loan that they will now take out is to increase their capital to purchase spare parts that they will get at stores that sell the parts wholesale. They (Andrea and her husband) will later sell the parts in their store. This work helps them generate income to help support their household; Andrea is married and has six children.

When ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, Andrea said that she likes the loans that are made through the group.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana con  47 años de edad, casada, con un nivel académico de sexto grado de primaria, madre de tres hijos, la cual una de ella estudia en la universidad, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio, dinero que le daba su esposo quien trabajaba en una empresa constructora. Actualmente es dueña de una pulpería hace 9 años, ella dice que hasta el momento le va  muy bien en su negocio, ya que ha surtido su venta con productos mas demandados y ha podido ayudar a su hija en los estudios.

Susana solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y jabón para reforzar más su pulpería. Este crédito le será de ayuda ya que podrá surtir su negocio con productos que aun no tiene en existencia y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. Ella dice que al terminar de pagar este crédito solicitara otro para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Susana, a retailer, is 47 years old and married, has a sixth grade education, and is the mother of three. One of her daughters is studying at the university. Susana started her business with her own money, which her husband gave her. He worked at a construction company. Now Susana has been the proprietor of a small grocery store for the past nine years. She says that so far, things are going well for her business since she has stocked up on the products that are in the highest demand, and she has been able to help her daughter with her schooling.

Susana is requesting this loan to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap to stock her store more. This loan will be helpful because Susana will be able to stock her business with products that are currently not available, and this way, she will be able to have better earnings. She says that when she finishes paying back this loan, she will request another one so that she can continue investing in her business.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAPATA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natividad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Natividad es parte integrante, ella indica que incorporó a la institución por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de elaboración de queso y crianza de animales, cuenta que estos negocios los aprendió de su recientemente, con el apoyo de  su suegro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de cerdos) que adquirirá de una comunidad cercana y posterior a la crianza lo comercializará en los mercados de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "CORAPATA" will begin it's first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Office of Copacabana. It is made up of 10 members and led by a board of directors in which Natividad is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied, including weaving blankets, selling milk, selling cheese and the sale of livestock. 

The loan that the is being taken out will benefit their small businesses with different focuses. Natividad indicates that they entered the institution because a friend of hers who is a member had invited her. She currently makes cheese and raises animals. She learned these trades recently with the help of her father in law. 

Her loan is being taken out now to diversify her business by buying pigs, which she will buy in a nearby community and will then sell in the markets of El Alto after raising them. They type of work allows her to generate income to support herself and her family as she is able to. She is married and has six children. 

When asks what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and loan training.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Luceros Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCEROS DEL ALBA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Blanca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de helados, tejido de ropa de bebe, tienda de llantas, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos y gelatinas, carnicería, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Blanca es parte integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados, cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una tía y que para iniciar el comercio tuvo que realizar muchos esfuerzos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las tiendas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y crédito
texts.en:
The communal association "Luceros de Alba" (Stars of Dawn) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional center of the Andes. It is composed of six members and is governed by a board of directors where Señora Blanca is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied. Among them are: selling ice cream, knitting baby clothes, tire store, neighborhood store, selling soft drinks and gelatins, butcher shop, and selling shoes.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small microentrepreneurs in their different areas. Señora Blanca is an integral part of this group. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Now she has a business selling shoes. She tells us that she learned this business from an aunt and that she had to put in a lot of effort to begin the business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying shoes that she will acquire from the stores that sell wholesale, and later she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as much as possible, since she lives with her partner and has six children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area, the training, and the loans.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Uriel Jose

texts.es:
Uriel con 45 años de edad, es de la comarca las Banderas, soltero, de oficio comerciante. El se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra cantera desde hace 20 años pero hace ya 3 años que compro su camión, con la ayuda de un  dinero que tenía ahorrado. Uriel realiza la venta de piedra cantera de forma ambulante en Managua con la ayuda de una persona a quien  le paga para subir y bajar las piedras. Ya que el cuenta solo  con el apoyo de su mama. 

 Uriel solicita este crédito para comprar más piedras canteras para el negocio. El estima que este crédito le  ayudara mucho porque asi  podrá tener más inventario y de esta manera  incrementar sus ventas para obtener más ganancias. Sus planes  futuros es  darle mantenimiento a su  camión, ya que sus metas es poder cancelar el préstamo, para volver a solicitar otro  para mantener mas estable el negocio.
texts.en:
Uriel is a 45 year old, single man from the district of “Las Banderas”. He is a merchant dedicated to the purchase and sale of stone quarry for over 20 years. Three years ago he purchased his truck, with money that he had saved. Uriel sales his goods on rounds in Managua with the aid of another person to whom he employs to load and unload the rocks. Besides his employee, Uriel’s mother is his only other support with the business.  
Uriel is asking for this loan to purchase more stone quarry for his business. He estimates that this credit will help him a great deal since he will be able to increase his inventory and therefore increase his sales and earnings. His plans for the future include servicing his truck; he is hoping to repay his loan as fast as possible, so he can request one more to make his business more stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stone quarry for his business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 45 años de edad y es padre cabeza de familia de dos niñas de 6 y 12 años a las cuales sueña poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecerles el amor que no recibieron por parte de su madre. Ricardo aprendió el oficio de confección gracias a su mamá, ya que ella siempre fue modista. Se ha dedicado a la fabricación de ropa interior femenina en su taller que tiene ubicado en su casa con el fin reducir costos. Su mayor sueño es poder consolidar su empresa generando empleos. En la actualidad se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de materia prima e insumos como tela, hilos, agujas ya que espera que la demanda de su producto aumente en la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en: Ricardo is a 45 year old father of two girls ages 6 and 12. He dreams about being able to offer a better quality of life for his children as well as to provide all the love that his girls were not able to receive from their mother. Ricardo learned the trade of dressmaking thanks to his mother that used to be a dressmaker. He has been manufacturing women's underwear in his workshop, which is located at home, in order to reduce overhead costs. His biggest dream is to consolidate his business creating jobs. Ricardo is currently seeking a credit for the purchase of raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread and needles, because he expects the demand for his products to increase during the year-end season

loans.use: purchase of raw materials and supplies (thread, needles, fabric)

loans.name: Rocio De Jesús

texts.es: Rocío tiene 41 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos de 16 y 19 años. Tras la muerte de su mamá, entró en un estado de depresión crónica, por lo cual tuvo que ser intervenida con psiquiatra. Este le sugirió que aparte de dedicarse a las labores del hogar debería ocupar el tiempo restante en otra actividad. Por esta razón y con la ayuda de su hermana montaron una tienda para que la administrara, laborando de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. Con esta actividad ella colabora con los gastos del hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder colocar al lado de su tienda un puesto de comidas rápidas, según ella es un buen negocio porque   en el momento no existe ninguno en el sector, como no cuenta con los recursos para realizar esta inversión, solicita un crédito que le permita materializar su proyecto.
texts.en: Rocio is 41 years old and is the mother of two children, ages 16 and 19. After the death of her mother, she fell into a state of chronic depression, for which she had to have psychiatric intervention. This person suggested to her that besides doing the housework, she should fill the remaining time with another activity. For this reason, and with the help of her sister, they set up a store that she runs, working from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening. With this business she contributes to the household expenses. Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a stand for fast food at the side of her store. According to her, it is a good business because at this time there aren't any [fast food businesses] in her area. As she doesn't have the resources to make this investment, she is applying for a loan that will allow her to realize her project.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart

loans.name: Johnnathan Harold

texts.es:
JOHNNATHAN HAROLD, tiene 19 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, carrera que eligió por su interés en la tecnología.
Lleva un año de estudios y la carrera que eligió tiene un plazo de duración de 4 años, él se esfuerza mucho en sus estudios para lograr sus metas y sobretodo no defraudar a sus padres quienes se han esporzado mucho para poder brindarles estudios superiores. Durante su tiempo libre se está especializando en el área de contabilidad. En un futuro al terminar su carrera le gustaría trebajar en lo que es aeronáutica.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de prácticas pre profesionales y exámenes del periodo de estudios.
texts.en:
Johnnathan Harold is 19 years old and studying for a degree in electronic and telecommunications engineering, a degree program he chose because of his interest in technology.

He has been studying for year, and the degree he has chosen takes four years.  He tries his hardest in his studies in order to achieve his goals, and especially not to let his parents down, who have made a great effort to be able to provide him with higher education. 

During his free time he is specializing in the accounting area. Someday when he finishes his degree, he would like to work in aeronautics.

On receiving the loan, he will use it to pay for pre-professional practicums and exams as part of his course of studies.

loans.use: To pay for practicums and exams as part of his course of studies.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
Doña Fidelia tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad. Es muy luchadora pues desde su juventud, se fue a trabajar a la capital, donde laboro como niñera más de 20 años. Durante ese tiempo administro muy bien su dinero y construyo una pequeña casa de adobe para sus padres que vivían en un pueblo lejano a donde ella trabajaba. Ella siempre ha sido una persona que siempre sea esmerado por el desarrollo de su familia, gracias a todo ese esfuerzo posee una tienda en donde vende productos de primera necesidad. 

La mercadería la compra en la ciudad, viaja en transporte privado, ya que hace un par de años sufrió una fractura en uno de sus pies, que le imposibilita caminar bien. Para realizar las compras tarda treinta minutos en transporte particular y lo hace en compañía de su hija. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mercadería para su tienda, debido a que en esta época es donde vende más y desea ofrecer más ofertas a sus clientes. Lo que pretende es poseer una estabilidad económica para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y también para que su negocio se posicione más en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 61 years old, and the single mother of three adult children. She is very determined, as at a young age she went to the capital to work, where she served as a nanny for more than 20 years. During that time, she managed her money very well, and built a small adobe house for her parents, who lived in a town far from where she was working. 

She has always been a person who has done her very best for her family's progress in life, and thanks to all that effort, she has a store where she sells basic household necessities.

She buys merchandise in the city, and travels in private transportation. This is because a couple of years ago, she suffered a fracture in one of her feet, which makes it impossible for her to walk well. It takes 30 minutes in private transport for her to make her purchases, which she does with her daughter.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy merchandise for her store, due to the fact that this is the time of year when she sells the most, and she wishes to offer more to her customers. 

What she intends is to have a stable financial situation, so that she can undertake improvements to her home, and also so that her store can be better positioned in the community.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store, due to the fact that this is the time of year when she sells the most, and she wishes to offer more to her customers.

loans.name: Jehu Asael

texts.es:
Jehu tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero. Vive junto a su familia, desde la edad de los 12 años aprendió el oficio de albañilería, su padre fue quien le enseño. Trabajaron mucho tiempo realizando proyectos junto con su papá, a la edad de los 19 años Jehu empezó a realizar trabajos de manera independiente y poco ha poco ha ido ganándose a sus clientes por su trabajo, confiabilidad y honestidad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para construir su casa, ya que entre sus planes esta casarse y desea tener su propia casa. Además, desea ir poco a poco comprando los muebles y electrodomésticos para cuando se case tener todo listo para cuidar y vivir feliz junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jehu is 23 years old and is single. He lives with his family. Since he was 12 years old, he has been learning bricklaying; his father was the one who taught him. He and his father spent a lot of time working on projects together. When he was 19, Jehu started doing jobs independently, and little by little, he has been acquiring clients, thanks to his work, reliability, and honesty.

This loan that he is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to purchase materials for building his house because his plans are to get married, and he wants to have his own home. Also, he wants to, little by little, purchase furniture and electronics so that when he is married, he will have everything ready to care for and live happily with his family.

loans.use: purchase materials to build his house.

loans.name: Elsa Nohemi

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa es una persona muy trabajadora  que le ayuda a su a su esposo  Eloy con la venta de Tacos y Hamburguesas  , ellos tienen dos  hijos los cuales  son lo mas importante en su vida, Jorge de 15 años y eloy de 6 años que actualmente estan estudiando, en el horario de trabajo de la noche su hijo el mayor es el que los apoya en el negocio a despachar y estar cobrando ellos estan con muchas ganas de  sacar adelante  su pequeño negocio ya que tienen planes de estar establecidos en un local o poner un pequeños Restaurante  , en esta ocasión  requiere del crédito para realizar mejoras a su carrrito de trabajo colocar lámparas y un techo para asi dar una mejor imagen a sus clientes y brindarles  un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Elsa is a very hardworking person who helps her husband sell tacos and hamburgers. They have two children who are the most important thing in her life. Jorge is 15 and Eloy is 6. Right now they are in school. At her job her older son helps with the business at night, delivering and collecting. They are people who really want to get their little business ahead, since they have plans to open a locale or a small restaurant. At this time, she needs the loan to do some improvements on her food cart, putting on lamps and a roof to give a better image to the customers and offer them a better service.

loans.use: to buy lamps and a roof for her food cart.

loans.name: Brisas Del Sur Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras, Juana es una de las socias tiene un taller de costura desde hace un año, es madre soltera con tres hijos de 29,28 y 14 años respectivamente, elabora ropa a  la medida y en series. El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima como telas, hilos, zipper, entre telas, botones etc. María Auxiliadora vende mariscos desde hace siete años y Yolanda es enfermera y en sus ratos libres vende cosméticos, ropa usada y nueva en su centro de trabajo y comunidad.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of three entrepreneurial members. Juana is one of the members. She has had a dressmaking shop for a year. She is a single mother of three. Her children are 29, 28, and 14 years old. She makes clothes that are custom-made as well as mass-produced. This loan will be used to purchase basic items such as threads, fabrics, zippers, liners, buttons, etc.

Maria Auxiliadora has been selling seafood for seven years, and Yolanda is a nurse who, in her spare time, sells cosmetics and used and new clothing at her workplace and in her community.

loans.use: purchase basic items such as threads, fabrics, zippers, liners, and buttons.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.es:
Sharon tiene 30 años, vive en la provincia de Guanacaste,es madre de dos niños, estudia turismo en la universidad, y su mayor anhelo es transmitir sus costumbres y su cultura a través del arte, precisamente su proyecto consiste en en crear artesanías con temas propios de la región y darlos a conocer vía internet, además de venderlos a los turistas nacionales e internacionales que muy a menudo visitan la zona donde ella vive.
Agradece la oportunidad de hacer posible este proyecto gracias al crédito de apoyo comunal.
texts.en: Sharon is 30 years old and lives in the province of Guanacaste, Costa Rica.  She is the mother of two children and studies tourism at the University.  Her greatest dream is to share her customs and culture through art.  Her work consists of creating handmade crafts with themes from her own region.  She then advertises them online as well as selling them to national and international tourists that often visit the zone where she lives.  She is thankful for the opportunity that makes her project possible and for the loan for communal assistance.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, fabric, and paint brushes, etc.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela Huertas es una mujer luchadora.Ella necesita de quinientos mil colones (₡500.000)para poder comprar cemento, block y ceramica. Con este dinero va a ampliar la casa para tener una mayor comodiad y asi resolver las necesidades de mejorar su vivienda. este prestamo es un gran beneficio para ella y su familia y le agradece a Kiva la oportunidad que le da a las personas de pocos recursos economicos.
texts.en: Mariela Huertas is a hard-working woman.  She needs 500,000 colones (Costa Rican currency) in order to purchase cement, block and ceramic.  With this money she is going to expand her house to make it more comfortable and thus take care of needs in order to better her home.  This loan is a great benefit for her and her family and she thanks Kiva for the opportunity that the organization offers for people with few economic means.

loans.use: To purchase cement, block and ceramic.

loans.name: Elkin Arias

texts.es: Elkin tiene 57 años de edad y toda su vida se dedicó a la vigilancia hasta que por circunstancias del destino se quedó sin empleo. Conducido por la necesidad decidió montar un puesto de verduras con el fin de conseguir lo necesario para vivir y para el sostenimiento y la educación de su hijo. Con el esfuerzo y la dedicación que lo han caracterizado montó una tienda para generar mayores ingresos. Su mayor reto es poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar su número de clientes ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de productos y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para fin de año. Su mayor sueño es poder darle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Elkin is 57 years old and has worked in security whole life, until circumstances of destiny caused him to be without work. Driven by necessity, he decided to set up a vegetable shop to be able to earn what he needed to live and provide for the education of his son. With his characteristic effort and dedication, he set up a store to earn a better income. 

His biggest challenge is making his business bigger and increasing the number of customers, offering a better variety of products. In order to do so, he is requesting a loan to invest in stock for the end of the year. His biggest dream is to be able to give his son the opportunity to study for a degree in college.

loans.use: purchase stock for the end of the year

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica atender una pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace 8 años  pues no quería depender de ningún jefe, su idea era ser dueña de un negocio que le permitiera obtener ingresos a diario y estar cerca de sus hijos por eso con el apoyo de su esposo puso la venta de golosinas, galletas y snacks que fueron los primeros productos con los cuales inicio la pulpería con el paso del tiempo le ha agregado más variedad y de esta manera ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  
Está requiriendo  comprar granos básicos, aceite, avenas, snacks, pan, detergentes, cloro, jabón, cosméticos, enlatados.  Una de sus metas próximas es vender recargas telefónicas y esquimos pues su idea a futuro es lograr convertir su  pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en: María, 55, is married and has two children. She is a shopkeeper and she works tending a small grocery store. She started this business eight years ago because she didn't want to depend on a boss. Her idea was to be the owner of a business that would allow her to earn a daily income and be near her children. This is why, with the help of her husband, she started selling candies, crackers, and snacks. These were the first products that she started with in the small store. With time, she has added more variety and in this way, she helps with the household expenses. She needs to buy more basic grains, oil, oats, snacks, bread, detergents, bleach, soap, cosmetics, and canned goods. One of her next goals is to sell telephone recharges and ice cream treats. Her idea for the future is to turn her small grocery store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, oats, snacks, bread, detergents, bleach, soap, cosmetics, and canned goods.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia de 40 años, es ama de casa y madre de 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son menores de edad. Su esposo es quien sostiene el hogar pero debido a su trabajo, su sueldo varía mes a mes, por lo cual hay ocasiones en que no alcanza el sueldo ni para el pago de los servicios públicos. María preocupada por la situación decide buscar otra entrada económica para colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y encuentra como labor la venta de productos por catálogo, actividad que realiza desde su casa y le permite cuidar a sus hijos. En estos momentos se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido  como jeans, blusas, accesorios, para  venderlo en fin de año. Su mayor sueño es que la situación económica mejore y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Eugenia is 40 years old. She is a housewife and the mother of 4 minor children. Her husband is the one who supports the home but because of his job his salary varies month to month and sometimes there isn't even enough to pay for the basic utilities. María is worried about the situation and has decided to seek another source of income to help her husband with the household expenses. She found work selling products via catalogue, something she can do from home that allows her to care for her children. At this time, she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as jeans, blouses, and accessories for the end of the year. Her biggest dream is for her financial situation to improve and to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (jeans, blouses, accessories)

loans.name: Francisca Jessica

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos de un año de edad que son gemelos. Ella actualmente, lleva un año dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza, como tintes para el cabello, desodorantes, maquillajes y cremas humectantes. Durante 13 años trabajo en esta misma actividad junto con su hermana, y desde hace un año lo realiza ella sola. También, trabajo durante tres años en una tienda de su mamá. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar azúcar, fríjol, arroz, aceite; para iniciar nuevamente con el negocio de la tienda que dejo de hacer su mamá. La tienda que abrirá Francisca será la única en la zona en donde vive, por lo que prevé que sus ingresos serán muy buenos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 22 years old.  She has a partner and one-year-old twins.  She has been selling beauty products such as hair dyes, deodorants, makeup and moisturizing creams for one year.  She worked in this business together with her sister for three years and has been working alone for one year.  She also worked in a store belonging to her mom for three years.

Francisca is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy sugar, beans, rice and oil so that she can re-open the store that her mom stopped running.  The store that Francisca will open will be the only one in her area so she anticipates that it will make her very good income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice and oil so that she can re-open a store

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco a salido adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo el Sr. empezó  como Ayudante en un taller,  posterior a esta situación  y al ver que dia a dia estaba aprendiendo nuevas cosas y se estaba desempeñando más y más  en su área de  trabajo decidio  hacer su propio taller que con dedicación y el  apoyo de su familia han logrado un poco más y ahora su sueño y propósito  es Ampliar su Negocio,  Pintar el negocio  y comprar mas herramienta que le hace falta  para ofrecer a sus clientes un nuevo servicio de Mecánica Rápida  para asi poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener mas espacio para trabajar.
texts.en: Mr. Marco has gotten ahead through effort and dedication to his work.  He began as a helper in a shop, and after a while, seeing day by day that he was learning new things and becoming more expert in his work he decided to start his own car shop.  With dedication and the support of his family he has been able to achieve a bit more and now his dream and goal is to grow his business, to paint the business, and to buy more tools that he lacks in order to offer his customers a new service of Fast Mechanics and in that way offer better service to his customers and to have more work space.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment for "Fast Mechanics"

loans.name: Norma Janet

texts.es: Norma, 48 años de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos, se dedica a vender sopas. Su primera experiencia en el mundo del comercio la tuvo hace 5 años  con una pulpería. Después decidió dedicarse a la renta de cuartos  sus mismos clientes le solicitaban comida fue por eso que decidió dedicar a la ventas de sopas pues son el plato que más le piden. Actualmente vive de los ingresos que le generan el alquiler de cuartos y la venta de sopas la cual vende todos los fines de semana. Su expectativa es ofrecer al resto del vecindario para eso requiere comprar más ingredientes por este motivo requiere el crédito para comprar verduras, carnes, vegetales y empaques para vender sopas. Uno de sus proyectos es comprar una cocina de industrial y dejar de cocinar con leña además  desea ampliar más el  espacio donde comen su clientela para brindarles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Norma, who is a 48-year-old mother of four children, earns her living selling soups. Five years ago, she had her first experience in the world of commerce with a small grocery store. Later, she decided to rent out rooms. Those renters were requesting food, which is why she decided to start selling soups, because soup is her most requested dish. Currently, she lives on the income generated by renting out rooms and selling soup, which she sells every weekend. 

Norma hopes to start selling to the rest of the neighborhood, so she needs to buy more ingredients. She needs the loan to buy vegetables, meats, and packaging materials for selling soup. One of her plans is to buy an industrial stove and quit cooking with firewood. In addition, she would like to offer better service to her customers by expanding the space where they eat.

loans.use: to buy packaging materials and ingredients like meats and vegetables.

loans.name: 21 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “21 DE DICIEMBRE”  iniciará el decimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dionicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de detergentes, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, artesanía, venta de productos YAMBAL, tejido de chompas, tejido a mano, pensión.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Dionicia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas, que aprendió a realizar con su madre, posteriormente decide trabajar por independencia propia y poco a poco amplia su mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones ya que se llevan a nivel familiar.
texts.en:
The “21 DE DICIEMBRE” community bank is beginning its 15th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office.
