Ivett quiere agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA que apoyan a jóvenes como ella a seguir estudiando
texts.en: Ivett, 24, is majoring in Pharmacy and Biochemistry at a local university, a five-year career; she’s currently in the fourth year.  She spends about 8 hours daily in her course work.  When she completes her training, she’d like to work in a clinical laboratory and is currently looking for one to do her pre-professional internship in.  Ivett requested her loan to pay her final monthly tuition for this cycle and to pay enrollment fees for the summer cycle.  Thanks to her loan, she’ll be able to advance with her objectives and become a good professional who makes her parents proud.  Ivett wants to thank Kiva lenders who help young people like her continue with their studies.

loans.use: to pay university enrollment and tuition fees.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su madre en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de carne fresca, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en un mercado cercano a la localidad donde vive, es muy concurrido de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y  con un excelente servicio; Ana es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carne por mayor. Ana María tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Ana María, 55, lives with her mother in her own house.  She sells fresh meat; she’s been in business for several years and has gained much experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  She sells in a market near her home.  It’s very busy with people and she has many customers who prefer her for the freshness of her product, the good prices, quality and excellent service.  Ana’s a very enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s always looking for alternatives that will lead to success.  Demand has grown in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this and make a new investment but does not have enough capital which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy meat at wholesale.   Ana María has good payment references and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan while trusting that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Mantillitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANTILLITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de café, librería, pollerería, venta de zapatillas, venta de salchipapas, venta de chalinas y lana de alpaca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Virginia es parte integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su hermana y en la actualidad lo sigue manejando ella.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las fronteras Perú – Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las amigas.
texts.en:
The “Mantillitas” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Virginia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are coffee sales, bookstore, slipper sales, ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] sales, scarf sales and alpaca wool sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen with various lines of work.  Virginia is one of them.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for a year having been invited to join by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling slippers. She relates that she started the business in partnership with her sister but currently she’s running it herself.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy slippers at wholesale along the Peru-Bolivia border and then sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to support her family however possible since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes sharing with her girlfriends.

loans.use: to buy slippers at wholesale.

loans.name: Ma Antonieta

texts.es: La Sra. Antonieta tiene 1 año con su negocio de Aplicacióny Decoración  de Uñas   ella  esta solicitando ell crédito para  comprar el  Maletin equipado  de Uñas , 1 Mesa y un Toldo (lona)  ya que se instala en Mercados cerca de su colonia pero como en este tiempo hay mucha  lluvia no tiene con que cubrir su material  ni a sus clientes;  por tal motivo quiere comprar la Lona también  desea tener el material suficiente  para  poder ofecer a sus clientes diferente variedad de Uñasy un mejor establecimiento  es  temporada  muy buena  ya que es el mes en el que ella tiene mas trabajo y le Ayudará a tener más Ingresos y Ganancias para su Familia.
texts.en:
Antonieta has had her nail salon business for a year. She is applying for the loan to buy a case for nail salon equipment, a table and a canvas canopy, as she is moving into a market near her neighborhood. But at this time of year there is a great deal of rain, and she has nothing to cover her materials or her customers. 

For this reason, she wants to buy the canvas, and also wishes to buy enough materials to be able to offer her customers various kinds of nails and a better establishment. 

It is a very good season, as it is the month when she has the most work and it will help her have more income and earnings for her family.

loans.use: To buy case for nail salon equipment, a table and a canvas canopy.

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: El señor Cecilo, Agricultor del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos han trabajado sus tierras y sacarle el mayor provecho posibles con los diferentes cultivos actualmente necesita darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de piña ya que con esto al momento de sacar la cosecha seran de calidad y sus compradores podran pagarlas a un buen precio, el no contaba con el capital requerido , Gracias a Fodos Kiva y Afodenic podra comprar los siguientes insumos: Abono, Urea, Completo, fertilizante. etc.
texts.en: Cecilio works in agriculture in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife and children.  They’ve been working their land to get the best possible profit from it with the various crops.  He currently needs to provide maintenance to his pineapple crops because by doing so when harvest time comes his products will be quality and his buying will be able to pay better prices for them but he does not have the required capital.  Thanks to Kiva and Afodenic funds he will be able to buy manure, urea, fertilizer, etc.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, fertilizer.

loans.name: Martita Corazon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARTITA CORAZON”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sucy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, venta de libros.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Sucy es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de venta de verduras, cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, ya que en su familia siempre se realiza la cosecha.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su negocio (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo sembrará en su huerto para que cuando ya se encuentren maduros los comercialice. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Martita Corazón” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Sucy.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are vegetable sales, sweater knitting, food sales and book sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen in different lines of work.  Sucy is one of them.  She indicates that this is the first time’s she’s formed part of the institution having been invited by a promoter who visited her at home.  She currently sells vegetables and says she learned this business when she was a little girl since her family has always worked growing crops.

The loan she’ll take out now is to diversify her business.  She will buy seeds from stores in the city of La Paz and will then plant them in her orchard so that she can sell them when they mature.  This way of working allows her to support her family however possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Reynaldo José

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo junto a su esposa ha salido adelante y construir una Familia, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la agricultura desdes que tenia 16 años de edad, actualmente  tiene una  manzana de Piñas y necesita darles mantenimieno, este credito sera utilizado para la compra de los siguientes insumos y fertilizantes: Abono, Urea, Completo, Diuton etc. Agredecido con Afodenic quien atravez de Fondos  Kiva lo han apoyado para mejorar s u bienestar  y mejorar de vida.
texts.en: Reynaldo and his wife are moving forward and building a family.  They have three children.  He’s worked in agriculture since he was 16-years-old.  He currently has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] planted with pineapples and he needs to provide crop maintenance.  He will use this loan to buy manure, urea, fertilizer, diuron [herbicide], etc.  He’s grateful to Afodenic who by means of Kiva funds have supported him to improve his wellbeing and to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: El Regreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL REGRESO”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de condimentos, confección de deportivos, venta de ropa americana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Juana es parte integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles, cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su hermana mayor, piensa que en el futuro el lugar de venta que tienen lo manejará ella misma, ya que lo quiere comprar con los ahorros que tiene.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de muebles) que adquirirá de las de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con las amigas.
texts.en:
The “El Regreso” (The Return) communal bank will start its 8th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Focal Center.  It has 10 members led by a governing board presided by Juana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are furniture sales, clothing sales, fruit sales, condiment sales, sportswear manufacturing and American clothes sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small, micro businesswomen in various lines of work.  Juana is one of them.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for a year having been invited to join by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has business selling furniture.  She relates that she started the business in partnership with her older sister.  She thinks that in future she will manage their sales point by herself because she wants to buy it with her savings.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy furniture in street markets in the city of El Alto and then resell it in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family; she’s a widow and has a daughter.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes sharing with her girlfriends.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La Señora María Cristina habita  en el casco urbano de Condega, en el departamento de Estelí a unos 30 km al norte.

 La señora Maria Cristina es comerciante y se dedica la elaboración y a la venta de pan y tortillas de maíz, tiene aproximadamente unos 25 años de dedicarse a esta labor y es su principal sustento. Ella elabora las tortillas a diario y el pan lo elabora tres veces por semana

Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por tres hijos dos varones y una mujer, cabe señalar que sus hijos son totalmente independientes y laboran en una empresa que produce Puros de tabaco

Esta clienta solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan y tortillas, tales como es la harina, maíz, aceite, manteca, azúcar etc. Ella espera que el financiamiento le sea otorgado pueda aumentar su producción y así abastecer la demanda y por ende tener mejores ingresos familiar lo que mejoraría su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Señora María Cristina lives in the urban area of Condega, in the Estelí department.

Señora María Cristina is a merchant and bakes and sells bread and tortillas made from corn. She has been doing this for 25 years and it is her main source of income. She makes tortillas daily and bread three times a week.

Her family consists of three sons and a daughter. Her children are completely independent and work in a company that makes cigars.

Señora María Cristina is asking for a loan so that she can buy ingredients to make bread and tortillas, such as flour, corn, oil, butter, sugar, etc. She hopes that the financing will be granted so that she can increase her production and so supply the demand and receive a better income, which would improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María de 42 años de edad, es muy trabajadora y disciplinada con sus dos  hijos, quienes estudian bachillerato y por quienes trabaja muy duro junto a su esposo, para darles lo mejor y brindarles un futuro mejor. María posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en donde habita desde hace 20 años, lo que la hace muy conocida en la zona y le permite contar con varios clientes fijos, los cuales son muy importantes para el mantenimiento de su negocio. María desea aprovechar la temporada de diciembre debido a que las ventas incrementan, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas, golosinas, especias, aceite, pan, granos básicos, y otros productos más que las personas buscan mucho más en esta temporada navideña. El deseo de María es mejorar sus ventas lo mayor posible y así recibir más estable el año nuevo.
texts.en:
María, age 42, is very hard-working and disciplined with her two children, who are in high school.  It is for them that she works very hard, together with her husband, in order to give them the best and a better future.

María has a store in the house she has lived in for 20 years.  This makes her very well-known in the area, and it allows her to have several fixed customers.  These customers are very important to maintaining her business.

María wishes to take advantage of the December season because sales increase.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  With the loan she will be able to buy a greater quantity of drinks, candy, spices, cooking oil, bread, basic grains, and other products that people look for much more during the Christmas season.  María’s wish is to improve her sales as much as possible, and by doing so she will be more stable in the new year.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her store.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos de los cuales el mayor se dedica a trabajar con él en su negocio. Marco posee un taller en el cual repara llantas para vehículos y motos. Así mismo el las compra y las comercializa por unidad y las que el cliente solicite. Su negocio es muy estable y cuenta con una ubicación muy estratégica ya que se encuentra sobre una carretera en la que transita gran cantidad de vehículos, sobretodo furgones y cabezales, cuyas llantas tienen un mayor precio a comparación de las demás. Marco solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder invertir en su taller, comprando mayor cantidad de llantas en diferentes tamaños y marcas, así mismo para comprar herramientas que son muy necesarias en el trabajo que realiza. Con esto Marco garantiza el mejoramiento de su negocio, surtiéndolo y por ende mejorando sus ganancias.
texts.en: Marco is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children, the oldest of whom dedicates himself to working with his father in their business. Marco has a workshop to repair tires for vehicles and motorcycles. To do so, he buys tires and sells them to his clients per unit. His business is very stable and has a very strategic location by a highway where a great quantity of vehicles pass through. Above all else, he sells to vans and cabs whose tires are more expensive compared to the rest. Marco is asking for a loan from Apoyo Integral to be able to invest in his workshop buy purchasing a higher quantity of tires in different sizes and brands, as well as tools which are very necessary in the work he performs. With this, Marco guarantees the improvement of his business by supplying it and therefore improving his earnings.

loans.use: to buy tires and sell them

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive  junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés y pan dulce, como quesadillas, pastelitos, tortas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la panadería por lo que prepara el pan mas exquisito, gracias a eso obtiene siempre las mejores ganancias; El negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda en una zona muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y además por el servicio excelente; María es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora, dia a dia busca buenas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar sus sueños y no se rendirá hasta tener el éxito que tanto se merece, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, dulce, leche, azúcar, sal, etc. María Inés tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: María Inés is fifty-five years old and lives with her partner and their children.  She makes her living baking and selling baguettes and sweet breads, like "quesadillas" (small rolls flavored with cheese), little cakes, pies and other items.  She has been in the business a numbers of years and has gained a lot of experience in her bakery.  She prepares the most delicious bread, thanks to which she earns a good living.  The business is located in her home, which is in a very busy area.  She has earned a lot of customers because of her good quality, good prices and also her excellent customer service.  María is an enterprising, determined and active woman who is dedicated to her work.  Day by day she looks for good opportunities that allow her to make her dreams come true.  She will not give up until she has achieved the success that she so deserves.  In the last weeks the demand has increased, and María wants to take advantage of an investment.  She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase wholesale flour, jam, milk, sugar, salt etc.  María Inés is a good financial risk and she is very responsible.  She assures us that she will be able to pay off her debt and at the same time trusts that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale flour, jam, milk, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Joaquin Eduardo

texts.es: de 23 años de edad, es una persona muy soñadora y con deseos de realizar su plan de vida de la mejor manera posible, él esta casado y vive junto a su esposa en la casa de sus suegros quienes le brindan un gran apoyo. Joaquín es empleado de una empresa privada en donde tiene varios años de trabajar, contando con buenas referencias ya que es muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo. Joaquín solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para construir su hogar y así independizarse de sus suegros, él tendrá que hacer unos arreglos a la casa en la que actualmente reside y en el mismo terreno hacer las divisiones necesarias para contar con una casa aparte, en la cual pueda vivir únicamente junto a su esposa. Con esto Joaquín contara con una vida mejor junto a su pareja y así mismo para sus futuros hijos.
texts.en: Joaquin, 23, is a big dreamer who wishes to accomplish his life plan in the best way possible. He is married and lives with his wife at the house of his in-laws, who support him greatly. Joaquin has been working for a private enterprise for some years, which gives good references of him as he is very responsible and fully committed to his work. Joaquin is asking INTEGRAL for a loan in order to have the money he needs to build his house and become independent from his in-laws. He will have to make certain improvements to the house he currently lives in and also to make some divisions on the same lot for him to build a separate dwelling for him and his wife. With this, Joaquin expects to have a better life along with his partner and their future children.

loans.use: to invest in the construction of his house

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José es un padre de familia muy responsable quien se dedica por completo a sus dos hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar y dependen por completo de él ya que José es padre soltero, por lo que debe trabajar y dedicarse al hogar y a sus hijos al mismo tiempo. José trabaja comercializando frutas y verduras en su pick up, vendiéndolas de forma ambulante por diferentes zonas del departamento en que reside, y por ya tener varios años de trabajar de esta forma cuenta con varios clientes fijos quienes cada semana lo esperan para comprar lo necesario para la alimentación de sus familias. José solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de verduras como: chiles verdes, tomates, cebollas, las cuales aumentan su demanda por temporada de fiestas navideñas. Con esto él podrá aprovechar al máximo su trabajo y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José is a very responsible father who devotes himself completely to his two minor children.  The children go to school and are completely dependent upon him because José is a single father.  He therefore needs to work and devote himself to his household and his children at the same time.

José works selling fruits and vegetables in his pick-up.  He sells in an itinerant manner in different areas of the department in which he lives.  Because he has been working this way for several years, he has various fixed customers who wait for him every week to buy the food they need for their families.

José is requesting a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of vegetables like green chilies, tomatoes, and onions.  The demand for these vegetables increases during the Christmas holiday season.  With the loan he will take full advantage of his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marta Celia

texts.es: Marta de 47 años de edad, vive únicamente junto a una hija quien se dedica a estudiar y en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a su madre con el negocio. Marta es una persona muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y contar con el sustento diario en su hogar. Ella trabaja comercializando ropa, sandalias y cosméticos de forma ambulante en distintas zonas, las cuales las divide por cada día de la semana, visitando varios lugares en donde cuenta con diversidad de clientes. Con el deseo de mejorar sus ganancias para este fin de años, Marta solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, aumentar la cantidad de sandalias y cosméticos que vende y así mismo comercializar juguetes los cuales se venden mucho para fin de año. Marta es muy trabajadora y desea salir adelante junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old. She lives with her daughter, who is a full-time student and helps her mother with her business in her free time. Marta is a responsible woman who works very hard to get ahead and provide the necessities for her household. She works selling clothing, sandals, and cosmetics door-to-door. Each day of the week she visits a different area in order to reach more customers.

With the desire to increase her earnings at the end of this year, Marta is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy children's clothing, men's and women's clothing, sandals, cosmetics, and toys to sell during the end-of-year shopping season. Marta is a very hardworking woman who aspires to get ahead with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, and sandals.

loans.name: Daysi Marlene

texts.es: Daysi de 38 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica para poder sostener a sus dos hijos menores de edad quienes dependen por completo del esfuerzo de Daysi, ya que ella es madre soltera y no posee ningún tipo de ayuda económica para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. Daysi es muy responsable, razón por la que ya tiene varios años de trabajar en la misma casa siendo de mucha confiesa para su jefe. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  para poder mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, así mismo para construir una habitación  con la que podrán contar con un espacio extra y así sentirse más cómodos y seguros junto a su familia. Debido a que su casa es bastante humilde, es muy frágil ante los cambios climáticos, gracias al préstamo otorgado, ella podrá reforzar además los techos y paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Daysi is 38 years old and works as a domestic cleaner to support her two children who depend entirely on her hard work. She is a single mother and does not get any other financial support to bring up her children. Daysi is very responsible, and that is why she has been working in the same house for several years as her boss trusts her a lot. 

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to improve the condition of her home and to be able to build another room so that they can have more space and feel more confortable and safer as a family. Since her house is a basic structure, it is very fragile and not very resistant to changes in weather. With the loan, she will also be able to reinforce the roof and walls of her house.

loans.use: to reinforce the roof and walls of her house and add another room to have more space.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 57 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la comercialización de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, y así mismo comercializa frutas y verduras. Ella vive únicamente junto a su esposo con quien dan lo mejor de si días tras día para contar con todo lo necesario para sostener su hogar. Teresa vende de forma ambulante sus productos y las personas la estiman mucho por ser responsable con los pedidos y por ser muy amable. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con la ilusión de mejorar sus ganancias, invirtiendo en la compra de más ropa en diferentes colores, estilos y tallas y así ampliar su margen de clientela, también para invertir en la compra de más frutas y verduras, con lo que su negocio prospere al igual que su economía.
texts.en:
Teresa, 57, is an enterprising woman who sells clothing for men, women and children, and also sells fruits and vegetables. She lives alone with her husband.  The do their best day after day to have everything they need to maintain their home. Teresa sells her products door to door and people think highly of her for being responsible with the orders and for being so friendly. 

Teresa is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL, hoping to improve her profits by investing in buying more clothes in different colors, styles and sizes and thereby expand her range of clientele.  She also wants to invest in buying more fruits and vegetables, so that her businesses thrive equally.

loans.use: to buy clothing to improve her business.

loans.name: Bessy Ruth

texts.es: Bessy de 42 años de edad, es muy alegre y trabajadora, ella vive junto a su esposo y  una hija de 5 años de edad, por quien se esfuerza día con día, ya que su deseo de que tenga una mejor vida, le da las energías para trabajar mus duro. Bessy es costurera y realiza diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir, las cuales comercializa en el mercado municipal, así mismo le distribuye a clientes quienes posteriormente vender las prendas en diferentes zonas de forma ambulante. Debido a que Bessy vive en un lugar bastante extraviado para llegar, ella desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de telas para cuando sus clientes lleguen ella pueda brindarles más variedad en colores y estampados para que realicen sus pedidos, es por esta razón que Bessy solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual tenga la capacidad de invertir en su negocio, mejorándolo para bien de su hogar.
texts.en:
Bessy is a very cheerful and hardworking 42-year-old.  She lives with her husband and 5-year-old daughter for whom she works hard for every day.  Her desire is to have a better life, it gives her the energy to work hard. Bessy is a seamstress and she makes ​​different types of clothing, which she then sells in the municipal market.  She also distributes to customers who then sell the garments door to door in different areas. 

Because Bessy lives in a place that's hard to get to, she wants to buy more fabric to reach customers where she can provide more variety in colors and patterns to carry out their orders.  This is why she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL, who has the ability to invest in her business, and thus improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making clothing.

loans.name: Edgar Osmin

texts.es: Edgar, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien cuenta con excelentes referencias de quienes lo conocen, ya que siempre esta en busca de una vida mejor. Desde hace 5 años que Edgar trabaja vendiendo minutas, las cuales poseen mucha demanda ya que son una golosinas muy tradicional de este país, las cuales están hechas de hielo bañado en jarabes de diferentes sabores y con un toque de miel de tamarindo. Edgar solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de jarabes de sabores, así mismo para comprar maquetas de hielo más grande y así poder atender a más clientes quienes a diario consumen las minutas que Edgar vende de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Edgar is a hard-working and responsible person who has excellent references from those who know him because he is always looking to improve his life. 

For the last five years, Edgar has been selling minutas (shaved ices), which are very popular because they are traditional sweets in his country. They are made of ice covered with different flavored syrups and topped with a little tamarind honey. 

Edgar is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can have enough money to buy greater quantities of flavored syrups, as well as bigger ice mold trays, so that he can serve more customers who, every day, buy the minutas that Edgar sells on the streets.

loans.use: to buy different flavored syrups and ice mold trays for his shaved ice business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel de 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 10 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Isabel se dedica a comercializar zapatos para mujeres y hombres, así también electrodomésticos para la cocina, los cuales vende de forma ambulante, esto trae algunos beneficios a pesar que es un trabajo muy duro ya que debe caminar varios kilómetros, beneficios como contar con varios clientes debido a que puede vender en distintas colonias y zonas en un mismo día. Isabel solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de zapatos y así mismo para solventar algunos pedidos que por falta de ingresos no había podido entregar. De esta manera Isabel tendrá a sus clientes satisfechos en todo momento y sus ganancias estables.
texts.en:
Isabel is 47 years old. She lives together with her husband and a 10 year old son, who is in school. Isabel works selling men’s and women’s shoes, and also kitchen appliances, which she sells as a mobile vendor. This brings some benefits – in spite of the fact that it is very hard work, since she has to walk several kilometers – such as having a number of customers, because she sells in different districts and zones in the same day. 

Isabel is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of shoes, and likewise to settle some orders that, for a lack of income, she hadn’t been able to fill. In this way, Isabel will have her customers satisfied at all times and her earnings stable.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sara Esperanza

texts.es: Sara  de 41 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos quienes son muy responsables y buenos estudiantes, ella es madre soltera, por lo que trabaja muy duro para darles todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable. Sara  trabaja en su propio negocio en el que se dedica a la venta de ropa para  para jóvenes, adultos, y niños, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante por distintas zonas del departamento que reside, contando con varios clientes quienes compran muy seguido sus productos, lo que es muy positivo para ella. Sara solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de más prendas de vestir y de este modo aprovechar al máximo la temporada navideña aumentando sus ingresos y así invertir más en el negocio en el año nuevo.
texts.en:
Sara is 41 years old. She lives together with her two children, who are very responsible and good students. She is a single mother, and because of this she works very hard to give them everything necessary to have a stable life. 

Sara works in her own business, in which she is dedicated to selling clothing for young people, adults, and children. She makes her sales as a mobile vendor throughout different zones in the department where she lives. She has several customers who purchase her products very frequently, which is very positive for her. 

Sara is requesting a loan from Integral, with which she will be able to invest in the purchase of more articles of clothing to sell, and in this way, take maximum advantage of the Christmas season, increasing her earnings and therefore investing more in her business in the new year.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Nancy Marilu

texts.es: Nancy de 25 años de edad, es una joven esposa y madre muy responsable, quien trabaja en su propio negocio y así brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para sostener juntos su hogar. Nancy cuenta con un molino en su casa de habitación el cual arrienda a diferentes personas que llegan a moler sus alimentos y maíz para negocios de venta de tortillas, debido a que es el único en la zona, cuenta con gran demanda, complicando en algunos casos el poder atender a todas las personas. Es por esta razón que Nancy solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un molino más, lo que le ayudará a atender a más clientes, mejorar su servicio y así mismo a percibir mayores ganancias, lo cual llena de mucha ilusión a Nancy ya que contará con una vida mejor para su hija.
texts.en: Nancy, of 25 years of age, is a young and responsible wife and mother. She has her own business that provides the necessary help to her husband so together they can support their household. Nancy has a grinder in her dwelling, which she lends to different people that come to grind their food and the corn used in the businesses selling tortillas. Since hers is the only grinder in the area, there is a high demand that sometimes complicates being able to provide service to everybody. For this reason, Nancy is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL in order to obtain the funds needed to purchase an additional grinder. The purchase will allow her to provide service to more customers and thus receive a higher income. This prospect fills Nancy of hope to provide a better quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a grinder.

loans.name: Oscar Isidro

texts.es: Oscar de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja y junto a dos hijas las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Oscar posee un negocio propio en el que se dedica a la venta de relojes, pulseras, aritos, anillos y otros accesorios más de oro y de plata, se encuentra ubicado sobre calle principal, siendo un lugar muy transitado, lo que es muy positivo para su negocio. Oscar solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de  joyas de oro y de plata, así mismo para comprar relojes y pulseras de otros materiales, los cuales tienen gran demanda por su bajo precios. Oscar es muy trabajado y positivo, y cuenta con muchos deseos de mejorar y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old. He lives together with his wife, who works, and two daughters who are in school. Oscar has his own business where he works selling watches, bracelets, rings, and other gold and silver accessories. He is located on a main street, as this is a very well-traveled place, which is very positive for his business. 

Oscar is requesting a loan from Integral, through which he will be able to have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of gold and silver jewelry, and likewise to buy watches and bracelets made of other materials, which are in high demand for their low prices. Oscar is very hardworking and positive, and he very much wants to improve and live better.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Esta mujer con deseos de salir adelante, vive en una localidad con alta violencia social y espera cambiar esta realidad para sus hijos en un futuro cercano, para que así ellos no sufran la influencia de la delincuencia, por eso se levanta cada día para brindarles lo mejor de ella, es muy conocida en la zona de residencia por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que se acercó a solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en: This woman with hopes of getting ahead lives in a locality with high social violence. She wishes to change this reality for her sons in the nearby future so they in turn are not affected by the influence of delinquency. Thus she wakes up every morning to give them her best. She is also well known in her area of residence for her humility and her dedication to work. She has never succumbed and she always pulls through from difficulties. With effort and dedication she owns a store that sells basic necessity products like basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, among others. She is very dedicated to her work and very helpful when she sells, this is why she has many customers that seek her and prefer her products. She now needs to supply her store with more products because of the increase in demand and she doesn't have the funds to do so. This is why she reached out to request a loan and thus be able to buy more products like basic grains, instant food products, sweets, and drinks. She trusts in God that soon the help she requested will be given, then her only concern will be that of making her daily earnings and taking them home.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, instant food products, sweets, and drinks.

loans.name: Nelly Del

texts.es: Nelly de 43 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a su negocio propia en el que comercializa golosinas, pan, bebidas frías y calientes, fruta y pupusas, entro otros productos comestibles más, su negocio es muy estable ya que esta ubicado en las instalaciones de una escuela, en donde a diario tanto maestros como alumnos consumen sus productos. Nelly es muy emprendedora y desea mucho poder mejorar las ganancias generadas por su negocio, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de: maíz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, verduras, y vinagre para la elaboración de más pupusas, las cuales tienen mayor demanda por las personas. Así mismo para comprar más bebidas y golosinas. Con esto Nelly podrá ofrecer más y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Nelly is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two young children. She has a business where she sells snacks, bread, cold and hot drinks, fruit, and pupusas (a Salvadoran favorite consisting of a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, beans, or meat), as well as other food products. Her business is very stable because she has a stall in a school, where students and teachers alike buy her products every day. Nelly is an entrepreneurial woman and would like to increase the income her business brings in. She has therefore requested a loan from INTEGRAL so she can buy corn, cheese, beans, cracklings, vegetables, and vinegar to make more pupusas, which are in high demand. She will also buy drinks and snacks. This will allow Nelly to offer more products and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pupusas.

loans.name: Crisel Yesenia

texts.es: Crisel de 35 años de edad, vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, quienes gracias a todo su esfuerzo se dedican  a estudiar. Crisel posee un negocio propio en el que comercializa ropa, calzado, juguetes, accesorios para el hogar, cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo y el cabello, accesorios para arreglo personal, y diferentes productos para regalar, su negocio es bastante estable y cuenta con una ubicación muy favorable. Crisel al igual que otros comerciantes desea aprovechar la temporada de fin de año en la cual las ventas mejoran notablemente, por lo que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  con el cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y juguetes los cuales son los que más demanda tienen en el mes de diciembre. Crisel es madre responsable y dedicada al bien de sus hijos, por lo que el crecimiento en sus ganancias es de mucho beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en: Crisel is 35 years old. She has three young children, and she works hard so that they can go to school. Crisel has her own business selling clothing, shoes, toys, home accessories, beauty products, personal accessories, and gifts. She has steady business, and her shop is in a great location.  Like other business owners, Crisel would like to take advantage of the end-of-year season, when sales increase dramatically. She has therefore applied for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and toys, which are in high demand in December. Crisel is a responsible mother who works hard so that her children will have a good life. An increase in her earnings will greatly benefit her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and toys to sell.

loans.name: Sharifbek

texts.en:
Sharifbek is married and has 4 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that he began his own business driving 5 years ago. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving now that his children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to repair his car.

In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which allowed him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a patient woman who poured out her passion and skills in cooking food as a business. She cooks food for snacks and daily meals and sells them to the people in their village. She is 53 years old and had three children.  

Alejandra is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in making her food selling business more profitable. She will buy meat, eggs and ingredients used in cooking meals to sell. 

In the future, Alejandra hopes to keep selling delicious foods to elevate her income for her family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs and ingredients used in cooking snacks and meals to sell

loans.name: Faateaina

texts.en:
Faateaina is a 29-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business.

Faateaina needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, baking powder and oil. She plans to use her profits to support her family members and pay for her children's fees. Faateaina has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, baking powder, oil, etc.

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en: Fiailoa is 34 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily goods such as sugar, flour, salt, chicken legs and much more. She has been doing this for more than five years. Fiailoa needs a loan to buy more stock, such as sugar, flour, rice, salt and tin fish, as well as a new freezer to replace her old one. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and to create savings for her children's education and for unexpected emergencies. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, such as sugar, rice, salt, tin fish and flour, as well as a new freezer.

loans.name: Manino

texts.en: Manino is 39 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for four years. Manino has requested a loan to buy materials to expand her house, such as timber, iron roofing, cement, nails and sand. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Manino will save for her children's education and to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as timber, iron roofing, cement, nails and sand

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, who lives with her four industrious children, has been engaged in fish selling. This business is her way of helping and providing for the needs of her family. 

In order to apprehend her plan of growing her business, she requests a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use it to buy fish and Styrofoam. A portion of this money will be used to buy at least two piglets to raise. With the loan and her hard work, she expects her income to increase, and then eventually that their poor living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy fish, Styrofoam and at least two piglets to raise.

loans.name: Hannah Lou

texts.en:
Hannah Lou, aged 21, has had to sacrifice and be patient in order to provide for the needs of her one child as well as maintain her business in the hopes she will soon have a progressive life. 

She is asking for a loan PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell in the village. She hopes that through the success of her business, she will be able to pay her weekly amortizations and save for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell in the village.

loans.name: Filoi

texts.en: Filoi is a 32-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, banana, yam and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Filoi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She will save her profits to expand her house and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, a wheelbarrow, and other items for her farm.

loans.name: Ateileen

texts.en:
Ateileen is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has more than three years of experience with this business. 

Ateileen needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oil, baking powder and a big frying pan. She plans to use her profits to support her family and save for the future. Ateileen became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, oil, baking powder and a big frying pan.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a simple sari-sari store owner, who is disciplined and hardworking. Daily, Elsa wakes up very early to open her store where she sells to farmers who are going to the farm. Getting up early is not easy for her but by thinking of earning an income for her family, she makes the sacrifice. 

She is now taking out a loan to stock more groceries in her store as requested by her customers. Using the loan amount of PHP 15,000 will be a big help in purchasing canned goods, cup noodles, spices, biscuits, breads and candies. This will not only bring her a good income but also improve their poor living standards and make them better.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, cup noodles, spices, biscuits, breads and candies.

loans.name: Pau

texts.en:
Pau is 41 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than eight years. 

Pau needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and filings. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. Pau will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's school fees and support her family members.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives and filings.

loans.name: Tseveen

texts.en:
Mr. Tseveen is 27 years old lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs, a province of Mongolia. He and his wife have been running a private shoe-making company together at home, she runs the business and he is the cobbler. Their daughter Shinetsetseg is two years old and stays at home. 

He was working as shoe-maker in a private shoe making company for years and he started his own home-based business as a cobbler with his wife in 2006. They are well known within the area and have built close relationships with customers. He is now requesting loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory and change their machinery so they can run their business smoothly. The borrower and his wife both are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and change their machinery so they can run their business smoothly.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is a 57-year-old married woman who has been running a business of electronic sales from her house for many years. She offers various products like juicers, tea maker, sandwich makers etc. She has become famous in her community and is making enough money to support her family. Her husband is working as laborer but has a small income. Her son also assists her in selling products to door-to-door 

She is liable to bear the cost of food and clothing as well as the other everyday expenditures. She needs to expand her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more items including electric irons, juicers, and sandwich makers etc., to inflate her sales. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy more items including electric irons, juicers, and sandwich makers.

loans.name: Xay

texts.en:
Xay was born in 1984. Her husband is a worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. Xay has a grocery store to earn a living. She earns 6,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy noodles, oil and beverages for her grocery store. She wants to use her benefits to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil and beverages for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1962. She has two children who have got married. Her husband and she are farmers. Mai earns 3,000,000 dong (VND) per month. She has done this work for 25 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and pigs. She wants to use her profits to buy more chickens and enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hawa is 53 years old and is a married lady. She has been handling a general store at the corner of her house for five years. She decided to initiate her business when her husband lost his job due to his severe injury.  Over the past years, she has managed her business and retained a good number of customers. She is a mother of seven children, one of them is school-going.

In order to support the needs of her children she requires her business to grow. For this she contacted Kasf Foundation five years ago. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more packets of grains, sugar and flour. She expects a boost in her net income and aspires to save money for her daughters’ wedding.

loans.use: to purchase more packets of grains, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1991. She has one child who is 20 months old. Her husband is a mechanic. Thuy sells clothes to earn a living. She has done this job for two years. She gains from it 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more clothes for her clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothes shop.

loans.name: Abdulwahd

texts.en:
Abdulwahd is 44 years old, a married man with six children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is a bachelor's degree. He is an employee in the ministry of education. 

He is requesting a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to buy a computer. He thinks this loan will help him to improve the quality of his services. He hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a computer for personal use.

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is a 39-year-old married man from Taiz, Yemen. He has four children. His has a degree.

He requested a loan of 200,000 YER to buy construction supplies for his home. In the future, he is looking forward to buying paint and furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy paint and furniture for his house.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en: Rifat is an active lady of 50. She has been running a machine embroidery business for many years.  She serves her community by offering unique designs, and she makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband works as driver. In order to fulfill the needs of her six family members, she is contributing enough in the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation, with which she has been associated for six years. Currently she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread and packs of sequins and pearls in different colors. It will help her to serve her customers on time and earn a good profit to fund her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread and packs of sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is a 25-year-old married woman. She faced a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago, she began a stitching business in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She is responsible for the needs of her two children. Due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Because of this, she contacted the Kashf Foundation to help meet the needs of her business. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has borrowed 17,000 PKR from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy reels of different-colored thread, packs of lace, buttons, zippers, and other materials for her business. These materials will allow her to increase her revenues so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread, packs of lace, buttons, zippers, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Khurram

texts.en:
Ms. Khurram is a 23-year-old, vigorous, unmarried lady. She has been doing a business of making fancy bangles for the past three years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her two brothers are employed as sales men but their income is not enough to support the family well. In this way Khurram is contributing much to the family income as her bangles are very much in demand and by now she has become popular in her community.  

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy raw materials such as artificial gems, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as artificial gems, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo lives in a village and is known to be a good fisherman. He is 54 years of age and married with five children. His two eldest children are settled in their marriages while the others are at home and are still studying. He aims to have a stable source of income so he can let his children finish their studies and improve their way of living. But fishing is not so stable, so he plans to buy piglets to raise. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to repair his fishing net and boat and to buy two piglets and feed. He believes that this loan amount will help him attain his goal in life and also help his piggery business to grow.

loans.use: to repair his fishing net and boat and to buy two piglets and feed.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Adama is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Adama was born in Makeni city, 38 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has five children attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Adama has been selling used clothes.

This is the first loan that Adama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Adama is going to use her share of the loan (500,000 Leones) to expand her business. She will buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old. She owns and manages a little store where she sells groceries and vegetables. She has operated this business for ten years and usually earns a profit of PHP 7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their basic necessities. 

Gina wants to add to her products to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to financial complications, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, sugar, oil, soap, bread, shampoo, cabbage, eggplant, onions and beans to sell in her store. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and their living standards.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, oil, soap, bread, shampoo, cabbage, eggplant, onions and beans.

loans.name: Suesue

texts.en:
Suesue is a 57-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Suesue has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, filings and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Suesue hopes to expand her plantation and grow vegetables in the future.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, filings, and chemicals.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms Sakina is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a beauty parlor for many years with her daughter. She is very familiar with techniques of make-up and hair styling. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Sakina's beauty parlor is small but fulfills the needs of the local community, and she is the highest earner in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more products for skin care and hair treatment, and make-up kits to cater for more customers at a time. She is also teaching make-up and hair styling skills to two students at this time so they can help her expand her business as well as earn money for themselves. She shared her dream of running a training school in her community.

loans.use: to buy more products for skin care and hair treatment, and make-up kits to cater for more customers at a time.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is from the village of Matani. She is 56 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 29-year-old daughter. Lali’s husband and daughter work at the local green grocery and get monthly salaries. The family is busy with an agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm. Milk is used for cheese production, which is sold locally. Along with the dairy, Lali is involved in clothing trading. She purchases clothes at a wholesale price and then sells them among her villagers at a retail price. 

Lali requested credit to purchase seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of the clothes to the customers and increase her sales, and, consequently, her profit. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 39 years old and is from a small village of Akhmeta district. She lives with her daughter and brother. Her brother is an artisan and works locally and gets a monthly income. Manana is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she has eight piglets and is going to raise them and sell them in the winter period at a good price. In addition, Manana owns a vineyard and produces wine and vodka, which is sold locally in an open market. 

Manana works hard and does her best for the family. She wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn’t enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Manana and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to repair the old house.

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en: Yaqoub is a 36-year-old married man who has no children now. He has a small workshop where he makes wooden crafts and decoration pieces. Yaqoub also make chair fillings, as shown in the photo, but it takes a lot of work since he does not have the needed tools for that. So, Yaqoub has applied for this loan so he can buy a new cutting machine and some needed tools for the workshop in order to expand and make more wooden items.

loans.use: to buy a new cutting machine

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a 30-year-old single lady living with her four siblings and parents. To participate in bringing more income to the family, Feryal started a small clothing sales business at home a few years ago. She sells basic children's and teenagers' clothes. Now she wants to get a new collection of winter clothing items and that is why she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to get a new collection of winter clothing items

loans.name: Osman's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to request for a loan of 5,100,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to solve their immediate financial needs. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

David is the featured leader of this group of teachers. He is 44 years of age. David is a native of Boajibu. He is married to a housewife and they have six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. David has served in the teaching profession for 14 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 44-year-old married woman. She is an active and talented lady who excels at stitching. She has two years of experience in this field as she has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Sajida wants to fulfill the needs of her family through all her hard work. She requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a new stitching machine, the reels of threads, buttons, and zippers in different colors to keep up with her increased demand and avoid delays. A new machine will allow her daughter to assist her in completing orders on time. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is currently living in a rented house with her family. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine, reels of thread, buttons, and zippers of different colors.

loans.name: Khadeejah

texts.en:
Khadeejah is a 28-year-old married woman who declined to have her photo taken for religious reasons. She asked her husband, who is also her partner, to be in the photo instead.

Having no kids until now has given Khadeejah and her husband the opportunity to expand their business in a short amount of time. They work in a farming business. They own a few plant nurseries and grow different types of plants and herbs for resale. Now Khadeejah wants to get more agricultural seedlings using this youth loan in order to expand their business and have more variety in what they grow.

loans.use: to get more agricultural seedlings

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
Saif is a 42-year-old married man. He has a small business with the help of his father that brings him another source of income besides his salary. 

He makes different types of crafts; most of them are antique designs. He even makes different sizes of aquariums as shown in the photo.

Now Saif has applied for this loan to buy new drilling and carving tools and more coloring sprays.

(Saif asked his father to appear in the photo instead of him for security reasons as he serves in the military and is not allowed to show his face.)

loans.use: to buy new drilling and carving tools and more coloring sprays.

loans.name: Saja

texts.en:
Saja is a 19-year-old married lady with no children. Saja did not let the fact that she got married early stop her from getting her bachelor's degree,

She is studying to become a teacher. Now she has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 35-year-old conservative woman. She asked her husband to appear in this photo instead of her for religious reasons.

Faten enjoys sewing, tailoring, making clothes, and adding artistic touches to any piece of cloth she has. So, five years ago she decided to turn her hobby into a business that would not only make her happy doing it, but also bring her an income to improve her life. She started by buying a sewing machine and some thread. Then, she informed all her neighbors that she had started a tailoring business in case they had any torn clothing. And since then, she has grown her business and contributed additional support income to her family and to her business.

Now, Faten has applied for this loan to buy more fabric, thread, and some beads to increase her productivity in designing and tailoring clothes and dresses. She hopes to open her own clothing shop where she can show and sell her designs.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, thread, and some beads to increase her productivity in designing and tailoring clothes and dresses

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
After collecting her previous loan, Iman added more food products to the store, which helped her to attract more customer in the neighborhood. 

This still did not satisfy Iman, so she applied for another youth loan in order to add more non-food goods to the store so she would have a variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Again Fayzeh asked her daughter Majd to take her place in the photo for religious reasons.

Majd has passed her second year in the university. Fayzeh is applying for another loan to continue supporting her daughter in her studies until she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, a 29-year-old married woman, is the mother of 6- and 2-year-old daughters and a 10-year-old son. 

Abeer’s husband is a driver, which is how he is supporting the family. 

Recently, Abeer chose to start selling accessories at home -- mostly fake golden ones -- that brought her a good number of customers in the neighborhood. 

She has applied for this youth loan to buy new designs of accessories to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy new designs of accessories to resell.

loans.name: Al-Shjah Group

texts.en:
Al-Shjah is a group that is composed of four women. They are from Hodiedh, Yemen, and they work together to help one another. They are hard-working, enterprising women who do not give up easily. 

Currently, they are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to increase their business levels. 

Ghzal is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old and a married woman who has four children. She started her business to sell incense and perfumes. For the last four years, she has been selling gas cylinders and clothes to customers, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. Her business has helped her to provide for her family. 

She is turning to AMB to request a loan of 50,000 YER because she has orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 44-year-old married woman taking care of her four children. 

She got an early retirement so she could start her small business at home, which is selling clothes, blankets and home appliances. 

Now she has applied for a loan to increase the quantity she has of clothing items as she wants to get a new winter collection.

loans.use: to get a new winter clothing collection.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his five siblings and parent. 

He goes to the governmental university to study accounting. Naser also works to be able to pay for a part of the university fees so he can get his bachelor's degree. 

Today Naser has applied for an educational loan in hopes that it will help him pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdulrahim

texts.en:
Abdulrahim is a 42-year-old married man with five children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is an employee in a government association who gets a low salary. He is hardworking man. 

He suffers from rain leaking into his house. He applied for a loan of 250,000 YER to buy construction supplies for his home. He hopes to a build second floor to improve for his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his home.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La cliente, Elena, es una señora de 24 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Francisco, la cliente se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 2 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y 1 en gestación, y la leche que produce la cliente elabora quesillo, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, la cliente vive con su esposo y sus hijos, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de cabeza de ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de quesillo, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio.
texts.en: The borrower, Elena, is a woman of 24. She is married to Francisco. Her business activity is producing raw milk, for which she now has two head of milk cattle in production and one in gestation. She makes soft cheese from the milk that is produced. At the present time she lives in the southern zone of Cochabamba, about 10 km from the city of Cocahbamba. The house where she lives is hers and her family's. She lives with her husband and children. The new loan from the institution is destined for the purchase of more milk cattle to increase her income through selling cheese, and in one way or another she will be able to met the needs that she has in her home.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est agée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants résidant chez son époux dans une famille nucléaire Sanoubougou I à Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Rokia après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée il maintenant 9 ans à la fabrique de savons qu’elle a appris auprès d’une amie. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois années où elle a bénéficié de cinq prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association BRILLANT de Sanoubougou I). Ainsi, elle est à son premier prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’acheter des matières premières nécessaires (huile de coton, soude caustique, déchets d’huile de coton  et pâtes noires).
Elle compte acheter avec ce  prêt, 10 futs d’huile de coton, 10 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pâtes noires), 3 sacs de soude caustique, 4 paquet de parfums et 4 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle achète ses matières premières sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et après fabrication, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 195 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Rokia is 42 years old, married, and mother of two children living with her husband in a nuclear family in Sanoubougou I in Sikasso (third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

After having tried her hand at many types of business without success, Rokia started making soaps nine years ago using a technique that she learned from a friend. She runs her business from her marital home, and she is is high demand due to the quality of her products. Three years ago, she decided to join the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy her growing customer base. She has received five group loans as a member of an association of women from her neighborhood (Association BRILLANT de Sanoubougou I). This is her first individual loan. The loan will allow her to increase her working capital so that she can buy the raw materials that she needs (cottonseed oil, lye, cottonseed oil waste, black soap paste).
